(1) When the probate court receives an incomplete coroner's certificate or only a death certificate, it shall, taking into account the relevant circumstances, draw up the coroner's certificate itself at the court or it shall order a court employee to draw it up outside the court or order the registrar to draw it up.
(2) The court may also draw up a coroner's certificate in other cases not mentioned in paragraph one of this Article, when it is reasonable to do so, if it has been proven by a death certificate or a public document that a person has died or been proclaimed dead.
